comment_text: One of my favorite professors. Kind and genuine and always makes sure everyone is comfortable. I’d say add more useful info on slides to help study. Thanks for everything!
While the class was one of my harder ones, I really enjoyed learning from Erin Carter. Super enthusiastic and passionate about the subject and always provided good feedback & informational lectures.
Study Guides pls! I studied way too much
Extremely good lecturer, expecially since it is her first semester here too. Excited to be in one of her classes next semester too
I love your lectures…Well worth paying attention.
Professor Carter’s classes were always enjoyable because we always came out learning how companies apply seemingly basic concepts to their marketing campaigns. Thank you!

Erin is one of the best professors I’ve had in the MBS program. During her mid-semester evaluation, some students expressed that exams covered too many chapters, and she accepts that feedback, and I have nothing bad to say about her now. She is also a great lecturer.
One of the best instructors I’ve had here. Enthusiastic about both the class and student evaluations.
I really enjoyed this course and how you ran it. Very down to Earth & enjoyable lectures that were always entertaining.
Best teacher in the Maine Business School. Engaging and great at finding ways to explain the material. I was sad when I had to miss this class. She is the Best the G.O.A.T.

Erin clearly puts much time & effort into her lectures. Her exams are difficult but fair, and one can do very well provided they put in the time & effort. She is extremely knowledgeable & is one of my favorite professors at UMaine.
One of the best professors I have had in my four years at this University
I had Erin 2 semesters in a row and she was fabulous both of them. Favorite business professor by far
One of my favorite professors I’ve had during my time at MBS. Funny, smart, and genuinely nice. Thank you Professor Carter!
Seeing as sales is a career I want after school, this course was extremely helpful. For a 1st time class it was well structured especially because sales seems like a tough course to construct.
I am really happy that I took this course. All of the lectures were worth attending. You explain topics very well and use very good (real world) examples.
I enjoyed this class. Dr. Carted presented all aspects of the sales industry in a fun way. Classes were always informative and entertaining.
Great class to take as a graduating senior heading into a beginning sales position. She is a great, engaging, and entertaining professor. Lecture was always worth attending.
Professor Carter demonstrates a true understanding of the sales topic and does a very good job of teaching this class. She is such a pleasure to have as a professor. Sorry I don’t have an eraser.
Erin has been a fantastic teacher and mentor. She has been a role model for me and I enjoy her teaching style. She always ensures the classroom environment is fun and respectful.
Instructor made class worth attending
Extremely helpful
Very encouraging
Class time was never a waste

Interesting prof who is fun to listen to and very friendly, appreciated the humor. Everything was laid out clearly and I enjoyed the course (do not see myself as a sales guy, but learned some great stuff for selling myself better).
Take away a lot of valuable information from this class that I feel will come in handy in my career! One of my favorite classes taught by a stellar prof!

Overall, I thought you did a great job. Even though it was your first attempt, I learned a lot of valuable information. I now know the intricacies of presenting oneself professionally  and how to structure proposals. In the future, maybe make slide shows a little more understandable, but other than that I liked how you brought character and personality to the classroom.
Erin is a very smart and caring professor. Her firsthand experience is extremely useful. She is engaging, interesting, and kind. Great class!

It’s nice having a fun, down to Earth Professor who can at the same time, provide her students with knowledge by intriguing them and making classes actually interesting. Erin is approachable and very helpful when students like myself need help or have questions.

Erin Carter has a passion for marketing, and it shows in her classes. She creates difficult, yet fair exams that test the important aspects/content of the course. I would take, as well as recommend, any course taught by Erin.

This semester, I decided to actually take classes that cover things I care about, instead of just accounting classes, and this was one of them. I have absolutely loved this class and I have learned so much that I know I will take with me to my future career at Disney. Thank you for this wonderful class!
Thank you for another great semester. This class and CB were some of the most enjoyable and beneficial classes I’ve taken here at UMaine. Have a great summer and best of luck with the new kiddo!

Originally did not plan to take this course because I didn’t think I had an interest in sales, but I needed an elective and this was the only one offered. After the first few weeks I gained interest in the class and realized how much sales goes hand in hand w/ marketing. On top of that Erin Carter is an amazing professor and I wish I was able to take more classes taught by her.

I took this class because I needed it for my minor but also because Erin was teaching it. I tokk a class with her last semester and loved the way she taught. All of her slides and lessons are relevant to today’s workplaces. She gives relevant and “hip” examples which makes it easier for us to learn and remember the lessons learned.
Lastly, Erin is an extremely attentive teacher, she makes time for all of her students and will take time out of her busy schedule to help her students and answer all of their questions.
Overall, Erin is such an amazing addition to the UMaine business school!
I loved the course and think Erin did a wonderful job.
Being the first semester and class this course was taught there were some hiccups and difficulties but I’m confident the next time she teaches the course it will be flawless.
It would be helpful for studying if the slides were more informative & easier to follow. Overall, I enjoyed my time in your class.

I think you are cool! But many students felt confused over the material. Maybe providing a book will reinforce the material that needs to be learned with concrete examples. If not maybe adding videos would help. Overall I did learn some but didn’t feel like I learned a lot.

Exams were extremely hard and I studied so much for all of the exams and didn’t do well. A textbook or better slides would definitely benefit this class because I feel like some information is lacking.

I felt this semester was challenging and I would like to think it was the class set up. I’ve never had a class in a computer lab and felt the tv’s weren’t useful for everyone and feel it could’ve been a better learning environment in an open class for more of a community gathering like the consumer behavior lecture room.
Did well taking on a class halfway through the semester. She made sure we learn (sic) what was expected and helped us along to understand concepts.
Professor Carter was very concerned with how well we were adapting to the change in instructors and she did an amazing job ensuring that nobody fell behind.
Although thrown into an odd scenario of picking up 3 class sections ½ way through a semester, Erin got us on track & made sure we learned the material.

Adapted the course well after circumstances, I almost wish she had given us a whole new syllabus for her half of the course, but I understand why, and it likely saved the class from some radical shifts in difficulty and content. Great professor, I wish I could take a full class with her.

I was not expecting to have Erin Carter as a professor for this course. She handled the challenge of teaching a course mid-semester extremely well. I appreciate her thoroughness and her ability to communicate all updates and changes to the course.
You are the best!
The lack of chapters and more of real life sales talk.
All of them. Teacher is amazing.
Lectures helped me learn a lot. The information was always presented clearly.
The real world examples during lecture were valuable for me.
The extra credit questions at the end of exams for extra credit.
Attending class! I enjoyed the lectures and enjoyed listening to the professor’s stories and references. Professor was passionate about sales!
Picking an item to sell and focusing on it throughout the semester
Having the slides uploaded on blackboard was very helpful to look back at or if an absence occurred
I valued the sales project that was worked on through various assignments during the semester.
Change people’s idea of selling.
Final presentation
Extra credit was always great! And it wasn’t just free points.
Study guides for exams
Add more real world connections to topics in lecture.
Maybe practice sales pitches 1 on 1. Like everybody picks a partner.
N/A Loved this class!
Check in quizzes
Nothing, Professor Carter does a great job of teaching.
More “sales calls,” maybe one on one with the instructor. My favorite aspect was the final I only wish there was way more practice before then
Genuinely one of the best MBS courses I have taken so far – thorough, organized, always interesting

I still very hard work this semester. I am  very confuse at the beginning of this class. How to study? Make me so confuse, the first exam make me feel so bad. But, at the end, I start to know how to study but it is at the end, I have no more time to improved my grade. If have next time I may be know how to study this type of course.

From a non business major, your class has been wonderful and my favorite in the department so far. You focus on learning and less on grades which I appreciate. Lectures are worth the listen so my only suggestion would be penalizing the students who are literally never in class.
Overall amazing teacher. Really great at getting the information across to the student. Actually sticks and won’t forget the info she taught.
Great examples were always provided w/ lecture so I could really understand what was being taught. Really care about her students and always listened.

Erin is one amazing professor. She gives lots of examples, she’s funny & cares about her students not just about the class. I’ve gone to Erin about a lot more than class materials & she’s helped me as a student & person.

Erin Carter is hands down the best professor at UMaine. She truly cares about her students and how they are doing inside and out of school. If this school had more professors like her, students would engage more. Erin has this way of making you feel comfortable enough to participate even if you don’t get the answer right. She was the most resourceful professor I had this semester!

I don’t usually take the time to actually fill out the full written evaluations, but I also don’t usually take a class that provides this much value to me as a student. The content was interesting, but made much more so by the instructor and her apparent optimism for the course. It was a pleasure, and I feel fortunate to have been a part of this class.
Great professor, engaging material and definitely one of my favorite classes I have taken at UMaine.
Erin has been one of the best professors I’ve had in the MBS. She is very knowledgeable about what she teaches and is concerned w/ her students and their academic progress.
The professor did a great job teaching consumer behavior theories as well as keep lectures interactive, current, and pleasurable.
Prof. Carter is a very thoughtful, engaged, and passionate professor. Her class was wonderful.
The class has been one of the most influential marketing classes I have taken. The material was great. The best part of each lecture was looking at actual ad campaigns and why they worked or not.
I really enjoyed professor Carter’s lectures. They were super interesting, but I learned a lot and the course challenged me.
Each class was fun and profitable. Which made attending this course every T, Thrs easy and worthwhile.

Professor Carter has provided my favorite class experience so far in the entire MBS. She is funny, interesting and very knowledgeable. I never wanted to miss her class and feel it was truly one of the most meaningful and beneficial classes I have taken in all of college. I’m looking forward to using her as a resource for my Honors thesis in the future!
Overall, Erin Carter is one of the best professors I’ve had at the business school, I would recommend her course to anyone. 10/10. Super energetic and makes learning fun.

Attending class was always worthwhile, and also enjoyable. Dr. Carter made sure that classes were entertaining and she is a very real, and relatable professor who is empathetic and cares about her students.
Learning the little things about how to market myself better to jobs.

Class discussions, for sure, and also the fun video examples that were used! It’s nice to have a classroom dynamic that is focused around the whole group having a conversation about important topics in class. It was always calm and respectful.

Erin Carter is one of the best professor in the business school, and makes sure that all of her students are well educated and getting the most out of their time in university. She has lots of real-world experience and truly knows and loves what she is teaching. She challenges her students but also is there to help you in any way that she can.

I’ve already said the majority of what I want to say in my comments for Consumer Behavior’s evaluation, but I would like to reiterate that your teaching style and personality are the maine reason I enjoyed this course so much. Thank you.

Erin has been so supportive to all of the sales students throughout the semester. She is dynamic and almost sassy in away that made it really fun to come to class. After the switch to online learning, she has been patient, understanding, and extremely gracious. Cannot express my gratitude enough for her as a professor and as a person in general!
Erin Carter’s teaching abilities.
This course detailed a lot of topics that I find very interesting. It helped me a lot with the career path I am interested in.

Professor Carter is by far the most engaging and relatable professor I have had here at the University. She is easily able to relay her in-depth knowledge of the course’s subject and does not bore or teach down to her students. She welcomes relevant conversation and discussion and takes every advantage to find new ways to teach, changing the class’s direction to best fit the learning styles and strengths of the students as a whole. Here assignments were pertinent and always worth doing. This class is what reaffirmed my belief in this field, and showed me what areas of the marketing world excite and motivate me. As far as I know, she will be the only one reading this, and if so, I want to say thank you for making this semester one of the best I’ve had, despite world events. You truly engaged my whole being, and I have spoken about you and what you’ve taught many times in the last few months with my family and friends.
The hackathons in which we were able to come up with our own ways to evaluate concepts we learned through lectures.

I really enjoyed the readings that were required for this course, the caught my attention and I was interested the whole time I was reading. I also liked being able to see my professor for the lecture videos, and the Hackathons that took place throughout the semester.
Your YouTube videos explained the theories so well
I wish there was more about how consumers can affect each other’s purchasing behaviors, especially who we consider “influencers”
More class discussion
Thank you for always presenting information clearly and making it interesting and relatable! Thanks for a great semester!
Really enjoyed this course and Prof. Carter is very kind and easy to learn from!
Give a quick overeview what is expected before the start time.
The hackathons were fun and excellent. I don't any improvement notes as of now

I thought they were amazing and could give practical applications to what we were learning about. I would encourage better group conversations so it was not reliant on one or two people to lead the presentation.
Fun and good way to learn hands–on

I really liked the hackathons that I was able to attend! I thought it was a great way to incorporate group projects into an online class! My professor was also very accommodating when I was unable to attend hackathons.

During most, there was more than enough time to complete the group projects. It might be better to either add a couple more slides to the projects or have presentations be a bit longer. The hackathon events could also just be shorter, so there isn't that gap where everyone is waiting for the presentation part to start.
I thought they were interesting and fun

I actually really enjoyed the hackathons. I liked being able to have some normalcy in a time where normal isn't found very often. I think maybe giving a requirement sheet before the hackathon may be helpful? Just so we can start to prepare answers and have some more time to give thoughtful answers and participate adequately when we are in our groups!
I enjoyed them, however they definitely did sneak up on me so sometimes I forgot all about them until the day of.
The Hackathons were interesting, it was a good way to pull the class together to incorporate the outside learning into the class.

I wish there were more synchronous class meetings. I like the interactivity those provide. As it was, I sometimes felt distant from the proceedings, so a little more synchronous class content would be good in my opinion

I think how understanding you were, and how flexible as a result should remain the same. The lectures were super interesting, but I would change the Kahneman book to be more reliant on articles because most students don't have much exposure to psychology so it felt very bulky, at least to me.
Maybe more one on one time with professor

I think that posting the weekly Q&A is helpful when there are non-time sensitive questions, even though I didn't use that aspect of the course, I think this is super helpful when there is a general question. Being able to see you talking to us in lecture videos keeps the videos interesting!
I think perhaps a checklist of what is due and when? It was run very well, I don't have a solid recommendation.

Thank you so much for an awesome semester. This was truly my favorite class, and that was mostly because I could do it all on my terms, but your lecture videos were always interesting and taught me what I needed to know about the course!
Thank you for a great semester, I would recommend this course with you to any student!!
Nope, other than thank you!
Fall 2020: BUA MKT – 002 – Consumer Behavior
The video lectures were very thorough and helpful, easy to follow

The video lectures were of most value because it was clear Prof. Carter is passionate about marketing and was very personable even though it was an online course. She was very responsive and on top of things.

I enjoyed how much this course made me think and I appreciate how helpful this course was for my major. My professor made this class interesting and knowledgeable in a way that was beneficial for our future. 10/10 would take a class with her again!
I would love to see nothing change. I really enjoyed the entire curriculum and class layout. The hackathons were very useful and enjoyable to attend.
Prof. Carter made marketing un and I believe everyone in my class would agree. I would definitely take a class with her again.
Erin Carter is a f***ing queen, amazing course.

The hackathons were very useful. My only suggestion would be to send an outline of the assignment maybe a day or two in advance because sometimes in the breakout rooms the group would have questions that we couldn't get answered for a period of time while we were supposed to be working on the assignment.
It was a fun learning exercise. Since it was an asychronous class, it was nice to still be able to work with groups
I enjoyed the Hackathon experience, however it was common that people in my groups didn't know what was going on and I was often left to do majority of the work.
I thought it was a great experience that allowed us to apply class topics to real life scenarios with our peers.
I enjoyed the hackathons I think you get a lot done in a short period of time.
The hackathons were great, sometimes they were a bit confusing but our professor also clarified if something was confusing.

I enjoyed them because it gave us students an opportunity to work together, which was beneficial in helping us comprehend the subject. Seeing other groups present help us practice our public speaking (while behind a camera) and task organizing while making these presentations within 10 or so minutes.
Giving each person a job because most of the time I was the one doing all the work
I loved the weekly layout and weekly quizzes. Almost everything should remain the same in my opinion. The lectures were super useful and you could tell Prof. Carter was very engaged in the subject
Maybe the Hackathon could be improved by meeting once prior to go over it so it is not all being done in one session. everything else was ideal and should remain the same
I can't think of much that could be improved––this is the best online class I've ever had.
Everything should be the same, it was one of my favorite classes I’ve taken
Wouldn't change a thing.
Adding exams to boost grades, we barely had any assignments just quizzes
you were a great professor and very kind.
Thank you so much, your course has been helpful in its lectures and you have been helpful in getting me through this stressful semester.
Being able to work together with classmates about the principles of marketing we were learning about and applying them to real life situations.

I really enjoyed the hackathons and learned a lot from them. The fact that I was able to converse and collaborate with my classmates was really nice and I learned a lot from being able to apply the concepts we learned in lectures and the books to an actual marketing project! With that being said, I also really enjoyed the books you assigned us to read from and your lectures. The books were very intriguing and your lectures were entertaining and informative.
Understanding of conscious processes of consumers.

One thing that I would have enjoyed watching in the class under the optional videos of the week is how you have had to apply the theories and principles throughout your professional career and your current research.

I think maybe more inclusions of podcasts would be cool! I don't think it is necessary but during the first week you had us listen to one to reinforce the topic that we were learning about and it was super interesting!
I was very satisfied with the concepts I was taught.
As a graduating senior, I can say with confidence that you have one of my top three favorite professors at UMaine.

I truly enjoyed your class and have found from it that I have a passion for psychology (along with marketing) that I didn't know about! and appreciated your teaching style and understanding of students during this difficult time so much. Also, I really appreciated your positive spirit and passion for consumer behavior. It made your videos and hackathon zoom meetings so much better than any other class! Thank you Dr. Carter!

I really really loved the way that we did our final presentations. I do not have much experience with professional interviews or pitches, so being able to role play as if I was doing one really made me feel better about what I could come across in the future.

I valued that Erin was able to give an option this semester to make others feel safe by letting us have the option to do it completely online if we needed and there was no pressure to come to class and there was lots of encouragement to go if we wanted. I liked how helpful she was and having video options to refer to all semester if we needed.
I wish we had more interaction with each other or had more of a build up with the sales presentation but overall was a enjoyable class!
Professor Carter was extremely knowledgeable, fair, and her passion for the content as infectious. In the future I will try to take more classes with her.

The only thing that frustrated me was that the video quizzes were uploaded at the wrong times, but I liked that she was flexible with due dates. I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot and I liked that information piggybacked over to this class from consumer behavior.

I thought that Hackathons were an amazing way to assess what we have learned. It thought us how to be thrown into a group and produce something really high quality in a short amount of time which is one of the more realistic assessment processes that I have participated in. Overall, I thought Professor Carter was amazing, so kind, and her passion for marketing really made me feel inclined to take interest in what she was talking about.
I can't quite think of one. I’m sure that if class would have been fully in person there would have been some really interesting activities.

Going to class always got me prepared for every assignment. If you attended class and did the assigned readings and lecture videos there will be no issue succeeding and genuinely learning the concepts.
Dr. Percival Carter provided a fun, upbeat environment to learn in, her videos were always so interesting to listen to. She made this class really fun and I enjoyed learning from her.
Presenting the information for the week both in class and through videos on brightspace was very impactful for my retention of the information. I wish more classes would use this same format!
Professor’s personal insights into the Marketing industry.
Online lecture videos.
I thought the videos and the quizzes were helpful because it tested my knowledge of what I actually learned.
The most valuable aspects were the readings and lecture videos, I felt like they offered a lot of valuable information.
Reading from Kahneman and Cialdini was much more interest and helped my learning than reading from a textbook would have been.
I’m not sure what else could have been added – the course was extremely comprehensive.
Perhaps another theory on how to influence others.

Hackathons were sometimes difficult to stay involved in. In one particular hackathon, I was the only male in the group and my ideas were constantly ignored but were then said by someone else and that’s when it was implemented. It may have been that group in particular, but it was frustrating to go through.
An amazing class and an outstanding professor. Truly knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. The videos she made were engaging and informative and the readings were always relevant.
I didn’t think the books were very helpful. Your lectures were much more understandable and taught me more than the book.
I really enjoyed this course and I thought it was super interesting and I learned a lot.
I really enjoyed this class. I learned a lot and your procedures were very fair and made the semester easier. Thank you!
All of the lectures were well presented with quality information that is super applicable.

I valued how educated the professor was, her excitement about the material and how well she knew all the content made learning throughout the semester that much more fun and engaging. I took a lot out of this class and always value a professor who is passionate about their class and work.

There is not a class in the UMaine business catalog that I have taken in my time here, that is as beneficial as this one. The only class that may rival this in terms or relevance to modern careers available to your graduates is Marketing Research with Dr. Rusty Stough, and that is very high praise. This class provides students with many tools required to be efficient and knowledgeable members of most types of businesses.

I really liked the final assessment. It truly builds on all the material learned throughout the semester and puts all that we learned together. Creating, practicing, and executing a mock sales pitch, especially one for my current job, was great practice for me as it applies to what I will probably have to do in the future.
I loved the organization of this class. Dr. Carter’s videos were really interesting and I really enjoyed watching them.
The whole sales process, other communication tips.

It would have been fun for a more experienced salesperson to come into the class as a guest and try to sell a product to the class to get exposure to the concepts in action, and also get experience as the customer to better understand how to get into targets minds from both sides.

Saying that this course needs something would be a disservice to the work put in by Dr. Percival-Carter. The University of Maine as a whole could use an overhaul in how they prepare some of their younger graduates for the realities of being a part of a larger workforce.
I can’t think of anything specifically that should be added to this class.
Celebrity/athlete management sales.

The two greatest assets that your business school has, for teaching modern business in a modern way, are Dr. Percival-Carter and Dr. Rusty Stough. I cannot emphasize this enough, and while many of my fellow students may not mention this, if asked 10 years down the road “which classes prepared you most for your current employment” they would list classes taught by Erin and Rusty.
Thank you so much for answering my questions and clarifying certain aspects for me!
Specific examples of research and real-life applications really helped to engage me in the material and help me with understanding if I had some trouble.
Your video guides and helpful attitude are what carried this course for me

Having the Hackathons was something I valued a lot. It was nice to have communication with the professor and other classmates. It was nice to work together and embrace each company/cause pretending we were working with them to come up with a solution.

The teacher was of most value. This was my favorite online class to date. I love this teachers online lectures. She is very pleasant to listen to and she has an amazing teaching style with lots of knowledge.

The lecture videos were really helpful and explanatory of the concepts we were being taught in this class. It really helped in completing the hackathons as well (which in my opinion were much better to help me apply the concepts I’ve learned in this course than any “regular” exam could). Additionally, the way the course was set up helped provide a routine, which really helps in an asynchronous class where otherwise the students themselves would have to create their own routine. For me, it really helped that all the assignments were due on Friday nights and open on Sundays rather than having everything available all at once.
How invested in the material she was. She was also very responsive and helpful when feedback was given.
Could you include quizzes in the Brightspace so they are shown in the due soon calendar? I have awful memory which I blame COVID for, and I always forget to do the quizzes on time.
The only thing I could say is being in person. I feel I could take a lot more out of this class if it were in person.
I think the teacher covered everything.
It might be interesting to have a few more examples of the different concepts we discuss in this course being studied in the real world or a few more real-world examples of concepts.
Mini assignments.

I greatly enjoyed this course, even with it being online! I thought that it was very beneficial to my interest in consumer behavior and was worth-while for someone who is not required to take the course.
Thanks! We can tell that you really want students to learn.

I think Professor Carter did an excellent job setting up this class, she really seems to have the asynchronous model figured out and I learned a lot from this course. She was also prompt in responding to questions asked during the duration of the course and providing a way for students to share their knowledge of the course concepts without “formal” exams. The hackathons she created for this course were, in my opinion, a much more effective way to test students’ knowledge and application of the things they’re learning, at least in this context. Overall, this course was well worth taking and Professor Carter has done an excellent job in teaching it and setting it up.

I really like when online classes have pre-recorded teaching lessons, Doctor Carter chose to use YouTube as her video outlet and I enjoy that one best because it’s easy to follow along with the closed captions/translation feature.
I felt that the weekly videos were very clear and beneficial to all watchers and created clear examples associated with the weekly quizzes.
As an aspiring salesperson, I just about all the concepts valuable and hope to use many of these new skills in the real world of sales.

I really liked the end of the semester sales pitch and internal sales document for our final project. I found that it was very valuable and brought together the entire course. I also liked the smaller assignments throughout the term that were meant to drive home core ideas and important concepts. I also liked the use of Salesforce.
Weekly videos were very informative and very well-made.
I can’t think of any at this time.
I think it would be good to have additional information/guidance around digital sales interaction and best practice.
Maybe another assignment or exercise like we did for our final. The sales pitch was fun.

I loved the way that the course was set up and I enjoyed taking this course. The only thing I might have hoped for is quicker results in terms of grading. It was sometimes hard to see my progress in the course with little feedback.
Good course! Thank you!

The professor cared so much about her students. She was flexible and understanding when students needed help. She always made sure to teach students how to use the concepts we learned in class in the real world and in their future career.
Lectures/lecture videos, Hackathons
The hackathons were valuable and preferred to a traditional exam. I was able to apply what I had learned in class to an actual marketing example.
I think having the ability to do hackathons rather than the ordinary test was very helpful. I felt as though I got to apply my knowledge rather than being tested on what I could memorize.
The video format for notes was very helpful. It was nice that you could pause to take notes or go back to it if you needed.

I loved that the class had the flexibility of being available online. I learned a lot through this course and found that consumer behavior is actually quite interesting to me and fits well with my interest in psychology.
Attending classes was very helpful and fun. I enjoyed talking about current events from a marketing perspective
I enjoyed the authenticity unit and the Chialdini section of the class.
I'm not sure, everything covered seemed to be of value.
Something I would like to see more in this course would be how we would promote from a more graphical standpoint if that would be possible.
general videos and examples were always helpful
Please keep using the hackathons as "tests"! They were a fun and less stressful way to test our knowledge on the concepts.
I like the idea of doing a hackathon based off of something that we watch beforehand.

To me, I think the Cialdini principles we discussed significantly were the more valuable insights in terms of marketing. There were many topics in this course which prompted critical thinking and generated a lot of genuine interest. That being said, the Cialdini principles of persuasion I think take the cake for greatest value in terms of content to take away from this course.

The online lectures were always very interesting and useful. I found that this was the most engaged I have ever been in an online course. This was the most I actually learned from an online course too. The professor was extremely caring and I respect her a lot.

I think this course in its nature doesn't really have any major flaws outside of external factors (stemming from this being an asynchronous course). I don't really have any more suggestions that would address anything Professor Carter hasn't already done.

I think this was a wonderful course, and Professor Carter was one of my favorite professors from this semester. This was a particularly difficult semester for me regarding workload from other courses, so I am sad to say that I don’t know that I gained as much as I likely would have, but I do have the desire to reread through the two books required for this class. Also, worth noting that Professor Carter is incredibly fair in her expectation and grading of course content.
A great semester, thank you Professor Carter!
Of most value to me were the videos. I like a lot of examples and visuals while I'm learning so your videos hit that spot on.

I loved Erin's lectures. She is among the most knowledgeable professors I have enjoyed getting to know, even online. She makes her online class particularly flexible to accommodate the busy lives of her students, who are likely taking the online course because of their lifestyle. Her assignments have a clear purpose and don't feel like busy work. Erin's "hackathon" model is a vast improvement over typical exams. I think that having students work in teams to solve an actual problem is a far better testament to the skills they've learned about in class than having them remember them for an exam. Erin is personable, reasonable, and very intelligent. Her class design, assigned work, and lectures are all valuable.

I will be completely honest with you; I felt that assigned textbooks weren't super necessary. They were interesting, but I felt they weren't always needed for the quizzes, so I found myself not paying too much attention when reading. Plus, the readings weren't super dense but long, and were easy to get lost in.

I enjoyed hearing about Erin's research. She doesn't like to discuss her work much, but I would love to hear more about how she practices the principles of her class in a real–world setting. I'm sure she has lots of exciting stories to share. The other professors at MBS speak so highly of her and her research.

You are one of the best professors I've had in a while. You were super organized and covered any questions I may have had in your videos. Your teaching has taught me so much as a new marketing student, so thank you for a great online class :)
Great class Professor Carter. Wishing you the best.
Spring 2023: MGT/MKT 490: Special Topics
The class was interesting, textbook was useful and no excess homework expectations which was motivating and encouraged me to complete my work

Everything, whether it was class, homework, readings, and even the tests I felt like I knew more after going or completing etc. This class actually helped me figure out that marketing may be the field of business I most enjoy.
I thought Professor Carter was very professional, enthusiastic and knowledgable about the subject of Marketing. She made it clear to students what needed to be done to succeed in the course material.
I loved the smart books, these helped me study for exams tremendously because I had what I needed to study at the click of a button vs making 100 Queue cards waisting hours doing that.
I liked the course! I would love more ideas on marketing people or ideas too!
Influencers, and their Impacts on marketing.
Thank you for such a great semester!
I really enjoyed this course. You were a great professor and the content you taught was really interesting. Thank you!
Thank you for being an amazing professor. I enjoyed taking your class!

I thought the Hackathons were most valuable to evaluate the most recent topics and to have these as a replace for an exam I really liked and feel like they made me learn the material better especially when we were broken up into teams
I liked learning about the psychological research aspect. Like different theories and findings about human behavior, such as art contamination and why humans try to be funny.
I thought all the content that was taught was all that was needed
I would like to learn more about how specifically to target consumer behaviors, rather than just learn about them
I though my professor was a very good teacher, I thought most of the lectures were useful and the professor in general knew what she was doing as well as she the content of the course
I enjoyed this class. I learned a lot and the work load was very manageable. Also, very good lecturer and very funny:)
The lecture videos were essential to do well on the assessment. I appreciated that assessments represent information presented in class.

Our time was valued and respected. We were given ample time each week to submit assignments and quizzes. The coursework, books, articles, and data tools used throughout the course were also beneficial, and I see myself using them post–class.
the lecture videos and quizzes that came after them

I found significant value in the comprehensive framework provided for understanding the intricacies of consumer behavior. The exploration of psychological, situational, technological, social, and cultural factors influencing the entire consumption process, from pre–purchase to post–purchase stages, offered a holistic perspective. Specific topics such as perception, motivation, attitudes, values, and the consumer decision–making process were particularly enlightening, providing valuable insights into the drivers behind consumer choices.
the ability to have the videos to re–watch classes

I really enjoyed the video lectures. They did a great job conveying the key aspects of the content in an engaging way. Similarly, the emphasis on keeping theories "Predictable and Parsimonious" was SO helpful! Oftentimes, scholars try to make theories so complex, and using the two p's to pare down theories really helps!
Including slides or bullets in the lecture videos to help keep students attention and make it easier to follow along/take notes.

I mean, the assignments and quizzes accurately reflected the coursework each week. We were provided more than enough information and tools to find solutions so I can't imagine any changes that need to be made.

I would find it valuable to include a section on the impact of emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence and augmented reality, on consumer behavior. Exploring how these technologies influence the way consumers perceive, interact with, and make decisions about products and services would provide insights into the evolving landscape of consumer behavior. Topics could include the role of AI in personalization, the influence of virtual experiences on purchasing decisions, and the ethical considerations surrounding technology–driven consumer interactions. Integrating these discussions would enhance the course's relevance in the context of rapidly advancing technological trends
SPRING 2024: MKT 374 – 0001 – Personal Selling and Sales Management

Being able to practice presenting was most beneficial. It was also great to know that the instructor had actual experience selling. It was great to watch some classic movies to show what sales was really like.
Class was always engaging and worth going to.
How to put together a sales pitch
I learned to always be closing. Create FABs and a positioning statement.
Loved the assignment structure
How to market yourself to employers/ recruiters.
Better knowledge of the class schedule ex: when exams are coming up/assignment due dates
Thank you for a great class and working with my busy athletic schedule during exans!
SPRING 2024: BUA 382 – 0001 – Consumer Behavior
Breaking down consumer behavior more as a thought process then just “why do people buy things”
Easy to navigate
Assignments were clear and what readings and content we needed to work on each week
Feedback on assignments was great
Over an interesting class, and liked this class a lot

It would be helpful for quiz grades and assignment grades to be put in throughout the course of the semester. As this is an online class and it is challenging to know if I am doing well in the class without a grade to reflect that. Most of the lecture videos are old as you can see that on YouTube. It feels as though the professor isn’t using current/relevant information.

I really liked the two books, they were more challenging the most textbooks, but not nearly as dry and having that as focus in class was a really cool different then most of my other business classes I’ve taken in the past! Really wish more classes would take this approach with teaching

This class should have never been remote... There was no teaching of basic knowledge of how to actually write R code. I think the class should have had a huge learning of the basics first and foremost. This was the most challenging part of the class, which only sets students up for failure. Yes, the videos discussed different punctuations, but it simply wasn't enough. Taking the first exam was like being thrown into the deep end without learning to swim. I ended up spending an entire week learning from YouTube and other resources to learn how to do it myself. This should have been built into the course.

I think that teaching through a screen is a very challenging concept, and despite that, Erin has been able to make me feel as if I was actually seeing her every week. Not only that, but she was able to share with me her joy and interest for the concepts we were learning, and that made me willing to discover things with her every week. I loved how the exercise were presented to us and how the work load was given.
Applying coding principles to real-life data

I think that we were provided with everything we needed to learn about what we later were asked to perform. I would maybe add any type of interaction with the professor in real time, at least once over the course.
Conducting research on our own.
I really enjoyed this class and even though I am not a big fan of coding, I had some fun working with it.

Really hard to follow what we were supposed to do, and the pacing made it even more confusing. Sometimes I didn’t have to look at the material for two weeks because there were no assignments, and then suddenly we were expected to remember everything and every little detail of a coding class. The long gaps without practice made it difficult to stay engaged or retain what we learned, and the expectations weren’t always clear when new tasks finally came up. More consistent assignments or checkpoints would have helped a lot with keeping up and understanding the material.

This was genuinely one of the worst courses I have ever taken. Was expected to know how to learn extensive code without directions. The content videos were no help, and she "taught" by providing vague examples in a written document. Did not grade anything for over two months. Took her over a month to grade an exam worth 20% of our grade. Does not answer her emails at all. She should be providing lecture videos that explain how to actually write the code, not on a written document. She also has gotten extremely lazy and would not post our homework for the week until Thursday or Friday, and it would be due on Sunday. Did not post assignments for three weeks, and is clearly in over her head. She needs to make some decisions about what her priorities are because this class clearly is not one of them.
Every lecture was the most valuable to me. Professor Carter did a great job explaining concepts and often showed short videos that helped our understanding and kept us engaged.
All of them!
The hackathons were very helpful attaching the material we had learned to real life situations. I enjoyed working in groups to do this as well to get multiple opinions.
I think the Hackathons are really valuable because they really get your whole group thinking and working together sharing ideas probably more than any other activity in the class.
I thought that the discussion nature of the lectures was really valuable to understanding the material.
Possibly groupwork every class. I think that this added a lot to the conversations we were having.

I really like how this class was setup personally, there isn't really a need for a long paper in this class but I would maybe say a longer, drawn out group project? I still think the Hackathons are great for group work.
Professor Carter is extremely knowledgeable on what she teaches. I was very impressed by her studies and the research she has done. I felt lucky to be learning from someone like her.
The humor lecture was amazing. I loved the setup of working with groups too
I think every class was of most value to me. The lectures were very interesting, and I enjoyed how, with the hackathon, we had to really put our knowledge of the topics to use
thank you for a great semester! :)
Coming to class everyday allowed me to understand the content more. I think all classes were worth attending and profitable for my knowledge.
Lecture and Hackathons, the hackathons allowed us to apply the information an a "real life scenario" and offered a much better understanding of the material

The class meetings were very informative and worth attending. As a class, we often engaged in group activities, making the class more interactive than most and also allowed us to learn practical/real life applications of the concepts we were learning about. The instructor was always engaged with the class, encouraging thoughtful discussions and interactive activities.
attending lecture and hackathons (and posted lecture slides)
I would like to see more groupwork. Understanding psychological needs can always be shown through real people, and these people could involve our peers.
Potentially quicker grading? I understand everyone is busy but it can be nerve racking when its the last week and half of the assignments aren't graded.
